intro: Smallanthus sonchifolius, commonly known as kiwicha, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its edible seeds, which are rich in protein and nutrients, making it a valuable crop for sustainable agriculture. Its leaves are also used in traditional Andean cuisine, often prepared as a green vegetable. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the unique climatic conditions of the Andes.
